name: The Pineapple Inn

reviews.title: Great, Clean, Close to the Ocean
reviews.text: The Pineapple Inn is a darling place on the ocean in Rincon. Great location, the owners are fun and make you feel like family. Breakfast in your room everyday. Coffee maker, refridgerator, microwave in the rooms all make it convenient and relaxing. The pool was clean and everything is above par. Highly recommend!

reviews.title: Feel Welcome at The Pineapple Inn
reviews.text: My wife and I just got back from a week in Rincon, Puerto Rico and I want to publicly thank our hosts Nelson and Mark at The Pineapple Inn for a really enjoyable stay. In fact, we enjoyed their hospitality and surroundings so much rather than spend just three days at the inn; we decided to extend our stay rather than taking a chance at another location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This quaint, comfortable and intimate little inn is literally steps to Corcega Beach a beautiful walking stretch of sand south of the center of town. Nelson and Mark have owned this inn for a little over a year and a half and two more personable and genuine gentlemen would be hard to find.
reviews.title: Pineapple Inn Overpriced
My regular spot
reviews.text: Upon our arrival, Nelson provided us with map and an oral orientation of the area including notable restaurants, recreational activities and local places of interest. He indicated he’d be happy to make any reservations for us during our stay. As stated earlier this is a small private inn that lends itself to customer service, attention to detail and relaxation. Take advantage of inn’s courtyard and sit with a nice glass of wine and listen to the sounds of the surf at night. The Pineapple Inn has none of the hubbub that one would associate with a bigger impersonal resort or hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms while not big are adequate, clean and comfortable and there is a swimming pool on the premises. The inn also just received a travel and tourism award at a recent convention in San Juan . Be sure to ask Nelson or Mark about the particulars of this award as it speaks volumes to their eagerness to operate a quality establishment. Call it the "luck of the Irish," but my wife and I could not have been happier. Gentlemen, well done and congratulations. Hopefully, we’ll see you next year.
reviews.title: Not a bad place

reviews.text: The Pineapple Inn is an amazing find in an otherwise bland selection of hotels along the western coast of Puerto Rico. Unless you want to spend (literally) thousands a night for an exclusive retreat, the hotels of Aguadilla, Aguada and Rincon are unremarkable, whatever the cost. And then there's the Pineapple Inn. A beautiful retreat on Corcega Beach, Nelson (the owner) keeps the rooms and pool area immaculate, and is overflowing with hospitality. He met me with maps and guides and recommendations and bent over backwards to meet my every need. When the time came to check out, I felt more like I was leaving a friend's house. The rooms are good sized, the a/c works perfectly, the satellite TV and wireless internet function flawlessly (you can't even say that in San Juan!), and the ambience is great. I will definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Great Little Inn!

likes.disliked: — Lack of really high quality restaurants within walking distance

reviews.title: Home away from home.
reviews.text: Just looking at the pictures makes me want to go back there. Nelson was the greatest host! Fresh fruit and rolls in the room every day. The place is very laid back - sat on the porch and watched the cat chasing the geckos, saw hummingbirds and listened to the ocean. The beach is a very short walk away. The water was beautiful. My brother and I played in the waves together like when we were kids. Nelson gave us some very good tips on restaurants. Our favorite was quesadillas at Nativo, which is very close by. I didn't want to leave. Thanks Nelson! Hasta pronto.

Found the Pineapple on Trip Advisor and based on the reviews, decided to stay. I highly recommend the Pineapple. Nelson is extremely helpful and friendly. It's a beautiful, peaceful, well-maintained, and clean property. I would definitely stay there again if I returned to PR. It's on a portion of the beach away from the big hotels and resorts, and although it is not located ON the beach, it is close enough to hear the surf all day. Stay here, you won't be disappointed
reviews.title: Great place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a four night stay at The Pineapple Inn in Rincon, Puerto Rico. I can not recommend the place enough based upon the facility itself, the location, and the incredible hospitality.
reviews.title: Completely Charmed by The Pineapple Inn

likes.liked: — Cleanliness of the rooms, hospitality of owners

reviews.text: FACILITY
reviews.title: A peaceful and energetic spot

likes.liked: — All waht I mentioned in my review

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights at the Pineapple Inn from January 19 through January 21st. The Inn is definitely a Piece of Heaven. It is very clean, the rooms are very comfortable, it is peaceful, the beautiful beach is only steps away, and the host was just wonderful.
reviews.title: Piece of Heaven

reviews.text: Nelson was always very pleasant and attentive. We truly enjoyed staying at this facility. We are planning on returning to Rincon in October, 2008 and have decided to stay at The Pineapple Inn again.
reviews.title: The Pineapple Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nelson- Thank you for everything. We will see you the second week in October.
reviews.title: Friendly little inn!

likes.liked: — The friendly staff, the cat and the bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Best Regards,
reviews.title: A hidden Gem in Puerto Rico!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Alex and Diana
reviews.title: Accomodating owners
Loved the Pineapple Inn!
reviews.text: We booked our trip to Rincon and found the website for the Pineapple Inn. As part of our information gathering, I made contact with the owners. They were extremely friendly and accomodating.
When we arrived at the Pineapple Inn, we were impressed with the beautiful little guest house. It's a friendly, cozy, tropical hideaway. The room was pretty and clean and nicely decorated.
reviews.title: The Best place to stay in Puerto Rico

reviews.text: The staff was great; helpful and informative.
reviews.title: Amazing time
Pineapple Inn - Great spot in Rincon!
reviews.text: We asked and were directed to many interesting and beautiful places in Rincon. The Innkeepers gave us great information about the area.

reviews.title: The Pineapple Inn is great!!!
reviews.text: When we weren't sightseeing in Rincon, we spent time at the Pineapple Inn's pool and tropical-garden-like setting; sitting under the palm trees and swinging in the hammock.

description: The Pineapple Inn is the second house before the beach, we are located about 15 (fifteen) steps from the sand. Our Inn is surrounded by gardens, and we have a pool. From part of the property you can see the ocean, and you can hear the waves from any part of the Inn. We provide daily continental breakfast and room service as well as free wireless internet connection. The Pineapple Inn is endorsed by The Puerto Rico Tourism Company. We are located at Corcega Beach, just south of the center of town. amenities: Continental Breakfast, Swimming Pool, Lounge Chairs, Beach Towels, Many Restaurants Nearby. Every Room Includes Air Conditioner / Ceiling Fan, Satellite TV with HBO, Small Refrigerator & Coffee Maker, Private Bathroom.
